text: The Yuba City Bears were a summer collegiate wood-bat club based in Marysville, California, in the United States and representing Yuba City, California. They were a member of the Great West League, having been established in 2017, and had played their home games at Colusa Casino Stadium adjacent to Ellis Lake, in Marysville. They had shared the facilities with the Yuba-Sutter Gold SoxTHE YUBA CITY BEARS ARE BACK, GWL website, January 12, 2017, but have since folded their GWL operations. ==Team history== The Yuba City Bears collegiate woodbat team gets its name from a former minor league baseball team that played from 1932 to 1949.NORTHERN CALIFORNIA BASEBALL----- CALIFORNIA BASEBALL HISTORY: YUBA CITY BEARS, Northern California Baseball website They were founded to bring back a natural rivalry with the Marysville Gold Sox as the original Bears and Marysville Giants competed during that time.After 68-year hiatus, Yuba City Bears back on the diamond, Kevin Scannel, Appeal-Democrat, January 12, 2017 On November 7, 2017, the GWL announced that the Bears were not going to play in 2018 and have since been replaced by the San Francisco Seals.SAN FRANCISCO SEALS JOIN GREAT WEST LEAGUE, GWL website, November 7, 2017 Colusa Casino Stadium, home of both the Marysville Gold Sox and Yuba City Bears ==Year-by-year record== {| class="wikitable" |- !
